post.summary: New - Create a new Device Policy profile for the given organization Group
post.description: Device Policy profile will have customized settings that can be applied on a Chrome device. These settings include auto-Launched Kiosk App,device Heartbeat monitor rate,application Settings for specifying list of apps that can be force-installed on a device,Email/SMS deviceStatus Alert Delivery settings etc.

parameters.name: devicePolicyData
parameters.description: Kiosk Device policy to manage a chrome device(Required)

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: Organization group Identifier where the devicePolicy profile needs to be created(Required)

400.description: Bad request - policy settings is invalid

get.summary: New - Retrieve the existing Device Policy profile
get.description: Device Policy profile will have customized settings (key/value pairs with pre-defined airwatch specific keys) that can be applied on a Chrome device.These settings include auto-Launched Kiosk App,device Heartbeat monitor rate,application Settings for specifying list of apps that can be force-installed on a device,Email/SMS deviceStatus Alert Delivery settings etc. *On editing a cloud policy, new version of the settings will be created.*

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: Organization group Identifier where the devicePolicy profile needs to be created(Required)

400.description: Bad request - policy ID doesn't exist

put.summary: New - Edit the existing Device Policy profile by creating a version of the settings
put.description: Device Policy profile will have customized settings (key/value pairs with pre-defined airwatch specific keys) that can be applied on a Chrome device.These settings include auto-Launched Kiosk App,device Heartbeat monitor rate,applicationSettings for specifying list of apps that can be force-installed on a device,Email/SMS deviceStatus Alert Delivery settings etc. *On editing a cloud policy, new version of the settings will be created.*

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: Organization group Identifier where the devicePolicy profile needs to be created(Required)

parameters.name: devicePolicyData
parameters.description: Kiosk Device policy to manage a chrome device(Required)

get.summary: New - Returns the details of a compliance policy based on the id supplied.
get.description: Fetches the details of the compliance policy based on the policy id supplied. It will include the details of the rules, actions and assignments that are defined, for the policy.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: Organization Group code at which the compliance policy is created.(Required)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: compliance policy id for which the details are to be fetched.(Required)

404.description: 1. {5055: Not Found - Compliance policy with id: {id} was not found or user does not have access to it.} 2. {5027: No organization group found for the given organization group UUID.} 3. {5012: User doesn't have sufficient permissions to perform this operation.}

put.summary: New - Updates an existing compliance policy in airwatch with the rules, actions and assignments provided.
put.description: Updates an existing compliance policy in airwatch with a set of rules, actions and/or assignments provided. If the device on which the policy is applied, violates any of the defined rules, the action specified in the policy, is taken for the device.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: Organization Group code at which the compliance policy is created.(Required)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: compliance policy id for which the details are to be edited.(Required)

parameters.name: compliancePolicy
parameters.description: Details of the compliance policy to be updated.(Required)

404.description: 1. {5055: Not Found - Compliance policy with id: {id} was not found or user does not have access to it.} 2. {5027: No organization group found for the given organization group UUID.} 3. {5012: User doesn't have sufficient permissions to perform this operation.}

422.description: 1012 - Unprocessable Entity 1. {id: id cannot be null} 2. {compliancePolicy: request body cannot be null or empty}

delete.summary: New - Deletes a compliance policy based on the id supplied.
delete.description: Deletes a compliance policy based on the policy id supplied.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: Organization Group code at which the compliance policy is created.(Required)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: compliance policy id for the policy which has to be deleted.(Required)

404.description: 1. {5055: Not Found - Compliance policy with id: {id} was not found or user does not have access to it.} 2. {5027: No organization group found for the given organization group UUID.} 3. {5012: User doesn't have sufficient permissions to perform this operation.}

post.summary: New - Creates a new compliance policy in airwatch with the rules, actions and assignments provided.
post.description: Creates a new compliance policy in airwatch that is a set of rules, actions and assignments provided. If the device on which the policy is applied, violates any of the defined rules, the action specified in the policy, is taken for the device.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: Organization Group code at which the compliance policy is created.(Required)

parameters.name: compliancePolicy
parameters.description: Details of the compliance policy to be created.(Required)

400.description: 1. {5012: Resource's organization group not found or user does not have access to this organization group.} 2. {5027: No organization group found for the given organization group UUID.} 3. {5012: User doesn't have sufficient permissions to perform this operation.}

422.description: 1012 - Unprocessable Entity1. {name: Name cannot be null}2. {description: Description cannot be null}3. {isActive: IsActive cannot be null}4. {ruleSet: RuleSet for the policy cannot be null}5. {actionSets: ActionSets for the policy cannot be null}6. {deviceType: DeviceType cannot be null}7. {ruleSet.ruleSetType: RuleSetType cannot be null}8. {ruleSet.rules: Rules cannot be null}9. {ruleSet.rules.operatorType: OperatorType cannot be null}10. {ruleSet.rules.ruleType: RuleType cannot be null}11. {actionSets.actions: Actions cannot be null}12. {actionSets.actionCategory: ActionCategory cannot be null}13. {actionSets.actions.actionType: ActionType cannot be null}

get.summary: New - Gets all Apple Device Enrollment Program devices at organization group.
get.description: Returns all the Apple Device Enrollment Program devices that have been synced into AirWatch for the given organization group.

parameters.name: groupUuid
parameters.description: Organization group UUID to perform the operation on.(Required)

400.description: 1. {5056: The organization group format is incorrect. Please enter a valid UUID.}

404.description: 1. {5053 : Device Enrollment Program account not found for the given organization group UUID.}2. {5054 : No organization group found for the given organization group UUID.}

put.summary: New - Fetches or syncs Apple Device Enrollment Program devices at organization group.
put.description: Fetches or syncs devices from the Apple server associated with the token uploaded in the given organization group based on the action flag.

parameters.name: groupUuid
parameters.description: Organization group UUID to perform the operation on.(Required)

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Action flag is used to determine if the fetch or sync action must be performed for the devices. Valid values are Sync and Fetch. Sync will only get the changed devices from the Apple server while fetch will get all devices associated with the token from the Apple server.(Required)

400.description: 1. {5055 : Action can be either Sync or Fetch.}2. {5056: The organization group format is incorrect. Please enter a valid UUID.}

404.description: 1. {5053 : Device Enrollment Program account not found for the given organization group UUID.}2. {5054 : No organization group found for the given organization group UUID.}

put.summary: New - Assign or unassign a Device Enrollment Program profile from device.
put.description: Assigns or unassigns the Device Enrollment Program profile to the device identified by the provided serial number based on the action flag.

parameters.name: profileUuid
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Device Enrollment Program profile.(Required)

parameters.name: serialNumber
parameters.description: The serial number of the device.(Required)

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Action flag is used to determine if the assign or unassign profile action must be performed for the device. Valid values are Assign and Unassign.(Required)

400.description: 1. {5055: Action can be Assign or Unassign.}

404.description: 1. {5053: Device Enrollment Program account not found for the given organization group UUID.}2. {5058: Enrollment token not found for the given serial number.}3. {8: Profile not found for the given UUID.}

get.description:
Retrieves the list of Certificate Authority (CA) for an organization group.
In cryptography, a certificate authority is an entity that issues digital certificates. A digital certificate certifies the ownership of a public key by the named subject of the certificate.

get.summary: Gets Vpn Types by Platform
Gets the list of Certificate Templates for a Certificate Authority (CA)
get.description:
Retrieves the list of Certificate templates for an organization group.
A Certificate template is a preconfigured list of certificate settings that allows users and computers to enroll for certificates without having to create complex certificate requests.
Enterprise certification authorities (CAs) use certificate templates to define the format and content of certificates, to specify which users and computers can enroll for which types of certificates, 
and to define the enrollment process, such as autoenrollment, enrollment only with authorized signatures, and manual enrollment. 
Associated with each certificate template is a discretionary access control list (DACL) that defines which security principals have permissions to read and configure the template, 
as well as to enroll or autoenroll for certificates based on the template. The certificate templates and their permissions are defined in Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) and are valid within the forest. 
If more than one enterprise CA is running in the Active Directory forest, permission changes will affect all enterprise CAs.
